subject: Learning
title: Environment Design for Focus
description: Learn Environment Design for Focus in one minute.

hook.text: A messy desk with a visible phone predicts distraction better than personality type does.

buildup.text: Your environment shapes your attention more than your willpower does.

discovery.text: Visual clutter competes for neural resources. Each visible object is a micro-distraction your brain processes.

twist.text: Even a phone placed face-down on the desk reduces cognitive performanceâ€”your brain knows it's there.

climax.text: Design your workspace for focus: minimize visible distractions, use noise-blocking, and hide your phone.

punchline.text: Don't fight distractions with willpower. Remove them.

quiz.question: Why does a visible phone reduce cognitive performance?
options: The brain allocates resources to resist checking it even face-down
Phones emit signals that disrupt brain waves
Only if the phone is ringing or buzzing
